intro: Hieracium eustictum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium eustictum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
